metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2343 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.0044.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-athena - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-gtk3 - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-gui-common - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-motif - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-nox - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-runtime - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
vim-tiny - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
xxd - 2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> the fix for this CVE added a new issue, CVE-2022-2522. when addressing this we should make sure to fix CVE-2022-2522 as well. in versions earlier than jammy, the vulnerable code is in ins_compl_add_infercase method.

criterions.comment: vim package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:9.0.0242-1ubuntu1').
